Quotes: Heroism on command, senseless violence, and all the loathsome nonsense that goes by the name of patriotism - how passionately I hate them!
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Half a truth is often a great lie.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Anyone who speaks in the name of others is always an imposter.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Lies are sufficient to breed opinion, and opinion brings on substance.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Talking much about oneself can also be a means to conceal oneself.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The liar's punishment is not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: An election is coming. Universal peace is declared, and the foxes have a sincere interest in prolonging the lives of the poultry.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The nationalist not only does not disapprove of atrocities committed by his own side, but he has a remarkable capacity for not even hearing about them.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of politics.' All issues are political issues, and politics itself is a mass of lies, evasions, folly, hatred and schizophrenia.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Speculation is only a word covering the making of money out of the manipulation of prices, instead of supplying goods and services.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Man should forget his anger before he lies down to sleep.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: One of the most striking differences between a cat and a lie is that a cat has only nine lives.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The main difference between a cat and a lie is that a cat only has nine lives.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: A prince never lacks legitimate reasons to break his promise.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: No one can lie, no one can hide anything, when he looks directly into someone's eyes.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition;oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: O, what a goodly outside falsehood hath!
Author: William Shakespeare
